boardgame.name: Archipelago
Archipels
boardgame.description: In Archipelago, players are Renaissance European powers competing in the exploration of a Pacific or Caribbean archipelago. They will explore territories, harvest resources, use those resources in markets both internal (for their use and that of the natives) and foreign (to sell it in Europe), build markets, harbors, cities and temples, and negotiate among themselves (and maybe betray each other) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; all this to complete their secret objectives. They will also need to guess the secret objective of the other players to be able to benefit from them._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;But players also need to be careful of the natives; if they make them too unhappy or if too many of them are unoccupied, they could revolt and declare independence. Then everyone will lose!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;According to the author, what he's tried to create is a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;German_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; economic worker-placement game, but without the two things he dislikes in them: the superficial theme and the lack of interaction. Indeed this game includes a very present theme and a lot of negotiation and potential backstabbing._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game includes three sets of objectives, enabling players to choose between a short, medium and a long game. Solo play is also possible with an expansion._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;IN FRENCH_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Archipelago retrace l_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;egrave;re majestueuse de la d_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;couverte des archipels _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;agrave; travers le globe de 1492 (d_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;couverte des Antilles par Christophe Colomb) jusqu_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;agrave; 1797 (colonisation de Tahiti)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Chaque joueur incarne un explorateur et son _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;quipe, mandat_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;s par une nation europ_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;enne pour d_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;couvrir, coloniser et exploiter les archipels. Ces missions sont cens_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;es s_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;effectuer de mani_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;egrave;re diplomatique, en r_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;pondant tant aux besoins de la population locale qu_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;aux demandes r_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;guli_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;egrave;res du continent. Il faudra donc respecter l_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;archipel et ses autochtones sous peine de voir les natifs se r_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;volter pour finir en guerre d_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;ind_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;pendance. Les limites entre expansionnisme et humanisme, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;conomie et respect des valeurs locales, transmission de connaissances et industrialisation _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;agrave; outrance, ne sont pas toujours _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;videntes _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;agrave; trouver. L_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;quilibre de l_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;archipel d_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;pendra donc beaucoup de la volont_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute; que mettra chacun _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;agrave; faire de ces _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;icirc;les des colonies heureuses et productives, ou au contraire, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;agrave; exploiter outrageusement les ressources et les natifs pour finir dans le chaos et la r_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;volte._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Pour compliquer les choses, parmi vous se cache peut-_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ecirc;tre un ind_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;pendantiste ou un pacifiste. L_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;un comme l_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;autre tentera de faire pencher la balance respectivement vers la r_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;volte ou vers la paix. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;Ecirc;tes-vous pr_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ecirc;t _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;agrave; endosser votre r_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ocirc;le et partir _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;agrave; la d_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;couverte d_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;Archipelago ?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Each player takes on the role of an explorer and their team, mandated by a European nation to discover, colonize and profit from the archipelagos. These missions are supposed to happen diplomatically, by answering the needs of the local population as much as the regular demands from the continent. Archipelago combines exploration, resource management, optimization, cooperation, strategy, negotiation, corruption, commerce, suspicion, alliances and betrayals, even a hint of investigation!

Reserved for terbear

In Archipelago, players are Renaissance European powers competing in the exploration of a Pacific or Caribbean archipelago. They will explore territories, harvest resources, use those resources in markets both internal (for their use and that of the natives) and foreign (to sell it in Europe), build markets, harbors, cities and temples, and negotiate among themselves (and maybe betray each other) – all this to complete their secret objectives. They will also need to guess the secret objective of the other players to be able to benefit from them. But players also need to be careful of the natives; if they make them too unhappy or if too many of them are unoccupied, they could revolt and declare independence. Then everyone will lose! According to the author, what he_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s tried to create is a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;German_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; economic worker-placement game, but without the two things he dislikes in them: the superficial theme and the lack of interaction. Indeed this game includes a very present theme and a lot of negotiation and potential backstabbing. The game includes three sets of objectives, enabling players to choose between a short, medium and long game; a solo option will also be included.
